examples.description: has a name and a breed
examples.full_description: Dog attributes has a name and a breed

examples.description: has an id that defaults to `nil` on initialization
examples.full_description: Dog attributes has an id that defaults to `nil` on initialization

examples.full_description: Dog attributes accepts key value pairs as arguments to initialize

examples.description: creates the dogs table in the database
examples.full_description: Dog .create_table creates the dogs table in the database

examples.description: drops the dogs table from the database
examples.full_description: Dog .drop_table drops the dogs table from the database

examples.description: returns an instance of the dog class

examples.description: saves an instance of the dog class to the database and then sets the given dogs `id` attribute
examples.full_description: Dog #save saves an instance of the dog class to the database and then sets the given dogs `id` attribute

examples.description: takes in a hash of attributes and uses metaprogramming to create a new dog object. Then it uses the #save method to save that dog to the database
examples.full_description: Dog .create takes in a hash of attributes and uses metaprogramming to create a new dog object. Then it uses the #save method to save that dog to the database
Dog .create returns a new dog object

examples.description: returns a new dog object by id
examples.full_description: Dog .find_by_id returns a new dog object by id

examples.description: creates an instance of a dog if it does not already exist
